Reviews.Content: The area in the front of the hotel looks abit sketchy. The hotel could use some updating/painting. Room was clean. Rugs could use a cleaning. Teenagers enjoyed the waterpark. Not enough tubes for the lazy river. If you want a two person or larger tube you have to rent it. We didn't have any cups in the room for coffe, had to go to the front desk for the cups. Other guest drank their coffe right out of the coffee pot. Nice area/patio to have morning coffee or relax at night. Large pool open late, enjoyed water park but it closes at 5pm. Not too far to restraunants.

Reviews.Title: “This place is awesome!”
Reviews.Author: thefam127
Reviews.Content: "This place is awesome!"-that's all we heard for the duration of our stay at the hotel! From the water park to the pool, to the b-bal hoop, to the arcade...even the room. We had 3 kids with us, ages 6, 10, and 16, and each one of them had not one thing negative to say about the place, except that our stay wasn't long enough! We honestly had not one single complaint about the hotel, which is pretty good for a group of 5..usually the 6 year-old can find something to complain about!

Reviews.Title: “Don't book your room here!”
Reviews.Author: joyinga
Reviews.Content: We booked our king jacuzi room onlineand guarunteed the room with a credit card. When we arrived the room was having "engineering problems" and was therefore not available.- neither was ANY king room available. We had to settle for a double queen room for which they were going to give us a "discount" of the same daily rate as any double queen room. Once we got to the room, we needed ice- Oops! ice machine was not working and Oops- no water in the vending machine! Went to refrigerate some items in the mini-fridge in the room and guess what?? It did not work. Next morning my husband takes a shower and ANOTHER MAN'S underwear was hanging on the back of the bathroom door along with someone else's shampoo in the tub! Hmmmm..makes you wonder if the room was actually cleaned. Additionally one of the beds was missing a blanket and we were asked what happened to it! Our key quit working and after 2 trips to the desk, we were told the lock on the door was dead. No cleaning service that day and we were down to no towels because none of the used towels were replace. NO...I would recommend this hotel to no one!

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected from a 3-star resort!”
Reviews.Author: marylehe
Reviews.Content: The location was very remote. We arrived around 7:30 pm and asked for the nearest restaurants. We were directed to several, but all were 20 minutes from the resort. As we entered the Lobby we wondered if we had just arrived at a Super 8 quality motel. It was definately a renovated older motel and that is exactly what it should be called "Motel" not "Resort". The front desk clerks were very understanding and offered us the key to check out the rooms. Rooms were adequate for a 1-night stay. The beds were uncomfortable, carpets were dirty and the housekeeping carts outside our room the next morning sounded like a train passing by. May be a nice stay for a family with kids and limited funds, but we will not recommend it or stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “My Disney vacation”
Reviews.Author: Mzeyecandy78
Reviews.Content: The Clarion is an excellent hotel to stay at. The children loved the pools and water park. The hotel is about 25 minutes from disney and no more then 15minutes from the airport (without paying the tolls) There are plenty of restaurants and gas station near by even some food places that are 24 hours.The rooms was clean and check in and out was fast. The staff is very friendly and helpfull. They also have a room there for kids to do crafts you can also bring games back to your room for the night which was very helpful if you are traveling with kids.would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: dontletthebbbite
Reviews.Content: Not as good as the website makes it look. Overall, my 5 year old daughter and I had a good time. The room was fine, nothing special, but we made the best of it. The carpets were quite dirty and some cleaning was overlooked by the maid -- mostly walls, which were quite dirty in the bath/kitchen area and hidden furniture -- like the desk that pulls out was covered with dirt and debris. The sofa was dirty and the bedspread also, but the beds were triple sheeted and clean so I just pulled the spread off. Our non-smoking room smelled of stale smoke (as did all of our clean clothes when we got home!) -- likely this is b/c all of the smokers smoke on the balcony/walkway that leads to the rooms. When I booked, I didn't realize how far this hotel is from the usual restaurants and stores. It felt like it was pretty much in the "middle of nowhere." The lazy river was fun for me and my young daughter -- the slides were too scary for her, but she enjoyed the lazy river and kids pool. I was too light to ride the slides without getting stuck. So anyone under 115 lbs, maybe more, will likely get stuck in the slides. The larger men had a great time -- the slides were very fast for them!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Motel Ever”
Reviews.Author: williams0627
Reviews.Content: This is a motel not a hotel. I have contacted Hotwire.com to hopefully with the pictures that I sent them reduce this to a 2 star hotel. Carpet is disgusting. walls have stains on them. BEWARE!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel and waterpark”
Reviews.Author: kitkat902
Reviews.Content: We had my daughter's 13th Birthday Party at the water park. We had 2 adjoining queens suites. We could not have asked for a better hotel. The rooms were in excellent condition. The kids (all 12 of them) had the best time ever at the water park, arcade and comedy show. Do not miss the free improv show on Fridays and Saturdays. This hotel has our highest recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: sewcute
Reviews.Content: just got back from a 4 day trip.  This waterpark is awesome, we really enjoyed it.  BUT... did not realize it was so far away from disney/universal.  We had to pay a cab $50 one way.  there is nothing in walking distance, it is way out there.  the beds were very comfortable, the rooms were cute.  the maid service however, they would take our towels and not return new ones, had to ask for toilet paper/tissues, and they never swept the floor, it was all sandy and felt like we didnt want to take our shoes off.  make sure you add $12 per night to the fee, because they charge you that for the waterpark even if you dont use it.  The bar/snack bar, took forever to find someone to help you.  the arcade was great, movie night for the kids was great, the big pool was heated, very nice.  the lazy river was really cold.  the waterpark hours were 10-6p.  the pool hrs. were 8-10pm.  the food was ok, but wish there was something near by to walk to.  the outside of the resort looks like a dump, but dont be fooled, the inside is very nice, set up like a big circle so you can see the resort from your room.  we got in at 11, check in was 4, and they had our room ready in 45 min.  so that was nice.  I would recomend this park in the warmer months, then staying there the whole time would be great.  I would recomend renting a car also, the cab fare will kill you.  there is a couple flea markets near that is really cool too.  I will go back, but summer time, and i would rent a car.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Adventure for Kids and Adults too”
Reviews.Author: PREZSLADY
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a weekend stay at the Clarion Resort and Water Park...What a fabulous Place...The Water Park and Pool are wonderful..for kids and grownups too!!! The location is perfect..very convenient, right at the entrance of the Turnpike. The rooms are beautiful, very clean , all newly done, .The one thing I noticed is the fact that there is no carpeting, so therefore the rooms do not have any odors.. There is so much to keep you busy..Basketball, pool table, an arcade for kids, flat screen t v's in all of the rooms...The staff was very helpful and courteous..The Hotel is only 20 minutes from Disney. We had a great time and would most certainly stay there again.. Thank you to the Clarion Resort and Water Park for a fabulous experience... Ina and Robert Rentzer Bob and Edith Kushner

Reviews.Title: “Probably overrated on tripadvisor”
Reviews.Author: Dave's_reviews
Reviews.Content: OK, here's the deal on this place. Some enterprising individual took an old motel in a not fantastic location, made some renovations and decided to build a "waterpark" to draw extra traffic. Voila! The Clarion Resort & Waterpark. The first thing you need to know is that "waterpark" is a bit of a stretch. They have 2 nice looking slides, but my preteens panned them. "Too slow" and "you get stuck" where the complaints. There's also a 2 foot "lazy river" that circles the slides -- it's OK, but it's not really deep enough or long enough for any adult or older kid to enjoy. There is also a conventional pool and hot tub, as well as some other water features that young kids (say, under 8) would enjoy. Indeed, the water features make this property a good choice for those with younger kids. Older kids might be a bit disappointed. The other "problem" with their set-up is that most of the water features (except the conventional swimming pool) are closed from 5 pm to 10 am, so you can't use them for a little entertainment on an overnight stop. Frankly, that's what the facilities are best for -- an hour or two's diversion. The park isn't nice enough to be a "destination resort," so keeping the waterpark only open during daytime hours is a bit odd. Otherwise, the property is typical of a Choice Hotels motel (quality inn, comfort inn, etc), which it is. By calling it a "Clarion," they get out of having to give you a free continental breakfast (although I understand they are considering providing one in the future). The rooms are up-to-date and are comfortable, but have the old-style outside entrances and big picture window. The refrigerator and microwave are obviously handy. The staff were all pleasant to deal with. If you have any use for the waterpark, the rates are quite reasonable here, although they "get you" with that $12 resort fee -- which certainly can be a bit unreasonable for overnight travellers who don't get to use the facility. The other thing you should know about is the location. If you're headed to Disney, it's a long drive on a very congested Route 192. You'll want to pay the massively overpriced toll (currently almost $3) to take the Osceola Pkwy to the Turnpike. Trust me, it's worth it. I think the property is a bit far afield to use to go back and forth to Disney. It would make a reasonable one-night stay if you're arriving early enough to use the waterpark. The hotel is only about 15 minutes south of the Orlando airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Resort! Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: keysmomma71
Reviews.Content: We just came back from Kissimmee for a short getaway (we are from the Florida Keys). I picked this resort because of the Water Park feature. We have a 3 year old daughter who was being treated to Disney & wanted something fun for her to do on the 1st day of arrival. The hotel allows you to access the Water Park on the day of your arrival & even allowed us to check-in early. We were fearful as a cold front had travelled through Florida the day before, but the pools and lazy lagoon were all heated so it was a very enjoyable afternoon. Now, I work for a big 4 star Preferred Resort in the Florida Keys, so I wasn't expecting luxurious accomodations, but I will tell you that this resort exceeded our expectations! The rooms were very nice and clean and the bedding was very fluffy with 4 pillows on each bed. The mini kitchen area was very helpful with a sink, microwave, mini fridge and coffee pot. I even discovered the ingenious "hidden" clothesline in the bathtub! The rooms are all equipped with flat screen tvs, desks and a chair in a seating area. The hotel also offers a business center as well as a game room "arcade" which kept my little one entertained and amused. We were also very impressed with how attentive the lifeguards were. At one point the female lifeguard called to another mother and told her not to worry because she was able to spot their little one floating in the lazy lagoon and the little girl was fine. She watched everyone in the pool area - at all times - very attentive! We will definitely recommend this resort to other travelers we know. After reading the past reviews - I wasn't too worried, even our gorgeous 4-star Resort in the Keys gets some nasty comments every now and then. Most negative reviews are derived from travelers that find one thing wrong and can't seem to find any "roses in the flower pot without thorns". Also - if you book through a 3rd Party, they will never tell you about the Resort Fee, but you WILL pay it at any hotel (we run into the same situation at our Hotel with guests booking through expedia & travelocity, etc.). If you ever saw the Resort I work for in the Keys - you would be amazed that we ever got anything less than wonderful praise. But - take my word for it - this Resort was very quaint and provided wonderful customer service. Great job, Clarion!

Reviews.Title: “You (Almost) Get What You Pay For”
Reviews.Author: MierGen
Reviews.Content: I was looking for an inexpensive room close to the Silver Spur Arena, and this is exactly what I got with this hotel. I was under the impression that I had paid the resort fee when I booked the hotel through Orbitz, but at check-in they were adamant that I had not so I coughed up an extra $12. Of course the water park was closed when we checked in and would not be open yet when we left the next day and it was impossible to park anywhere near our room, so I'm not sure what this $12 was supposed to cover. As for the room itself, all I can say is, "yuck!" The carpet was so filthy that the parts that weren't stained were almost black. The chairs in the room both were covered wtih stains - so much so that I would not allow my daughter to sit on them. The whole room smelled mildewy, and there was red mildew growing rampant in the bathroom. It's no wonder it was full of mildew as the shower curtain did not fit all the way across the tub so the water ran out of the shower and flooded the whole bathroom. There was so much water it actually ran out of the bathroom, under the door into the sink/"kitchenette" area. (Kitchenette is in quotes because it's really just a mini-fridge and microwave next to the bathroom sink. The walls are paper-thin and we could hear everything that was going on in the room next to us, enough so that we could actually make out the words that they were saying. Outside is even worse. Since the hotel has outdoor halls and no sound barriers to the room, we were woken up several times between 2am and 4am with people running up and down the halls, shouting from the hall down into the parking lot, etc. Even with the discounted rate, this hotel was a rip-off. It was dirty and noisy, and I will not be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: JotaGA
Reviews.Content: When our family stayed at the Clarion Resort Waterpark it was one of the best experiences we have ever had. When we got there we were early by about 4 hours and they told us to go ahead and use the waterpark and all the ammenities while they got our room ready. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The rooms weren't luxurious or anything, but they were really good for the price. It was very family oriented and we will stay again. I recommend staying here to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best!”
Reviews.Author: TommyTPA
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights here 13-16, Jan, 09 . Booked thru Priceline, who touted they had "upgraded" me to a 2 1/2 star from a 2 star! Check in was very friendly. I was told about the $12, per day, resort fee that covered "stuff 'like parking and the waterpark." This place is not really near ANYTHING that would necessitate charging for parking. Due to the cold, and rainy weather, nobody was going to use the waterpark. There is NO complimentary breakfast, or coffee, but there are coffee makers in the rooms.....coffee was not very good. When checking out, the resort fee had inflated to $13.56,per nite, including taxes. The Resort is about 16 miles in stop and go traffic on 192 from Disney. The linens and towels were great. The bed was somewhat on the hard side, and the pillows too thin. The shower head was good, but the shower curtain didn't make it down to the shower edge and extended over the bathroom floor. To keep from flooding the room I had to hug the wall, and aim the shower to the wall. Wasn't impressed with the "French Milled" soap, but there were Neutragena (sp?) lotion, shampoo, and conditioner. The heat worked great! Housekeeping was not very adept at making the bed, my grand kids do a better job! The same little particles of stuff were on the floor for the duration, indicating the floor wasn't cleaned. The floor is ceramic tile...good, and bad points. My main critique was that you could join in your adjoining room conversation, if so desired. There was no threshold on the ceramic floor between the room allowing light and conversation to enter your privacy. I really thought someone was in my room when I was awoken by my neighbors. You could actually understand very well what was being said. The noise from housekeeping, and laundry carts was loud too. I thought it was close jet planes overhead. The safe was locked upon my arrival necessitating 2 trips from maintenance. There were 2 bulbs out over the sink, and the towel rack was balanced on the wall, but would fall off when you touched the towel. There were no Kleenexes, and when I asked for some was told there weren't any, and was offered a roll of Toilet Paper, which was not of "facial" softness. In my 3 night stay, no kleenex. The refrigerator froze the soft drinks I placed in the door compartment. It had been turned up to max...guess I should have checked it when I checked in, or maybe housekeeping should add this to their routine! When I checked out I gave the clerk a written list that they may want to address for room 4101. She just said "OK, thanks". Not a 2 1/2 star...more a 1 1/2, in my opinion. This place would be great for families in good weather,the room was nice, but the $12, er $13,56, fee is too much for the amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Good For Families”
Reviews.Author: Luvtravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Clarion 12/26/08- 1/2/09 to ring in the new Year with Disney. Booked last minute so we could only get a standard room. For a family with 2 kids , we prefer suites/ larger rooms; but overall accomodations were fine. Room was clean and pleasant, bathroom was very small. Staff are friendly and responsive. Housekeeping staff are friendly, but frequently forgot to leave washcloths/ adequate towels. These were minor issues, did not affect our vacation as we spent most of our time at Disney & Universal studios. We did not use the waterpark, but the people that were there appeared to be enjoying themselves. This is a good, family friendly, value, hotel for folks vacationing with the Mouse.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden fee, rude staff and lousy service..”
Reviews.Author: honsyu21
Reviews.Content: In short, this hotel is terrible. 1. This hotel had hidden fee. Once you check in, you should pay $13.56 as "resort fee" in addition to the room charge even though you stay only one night! Sometimes, when you appeal more strongly, it seems they might give you a small "discount" of $4.. I booked this hotel through Priceline, but I did not get notified of this "resort fee" when my offer price was accepted by this hotel. If the "resort fee" was necessary, they should not have accepted my price in the firlst place. In conclusion, this was hidden fee and anybody who considers to stay at this hotel should be prepared to pay additional $13.56 when checking in. Of course, this hotel does not serve complimentary breakfast and you should also be prepared to pay additional charge for their so called "breakfast". In addition to that, the staff at the front desk was very, very rude and kept on saying "pay the resort fee, don't do this in the room and don't do that in the room just like instructing kindergarten children.. I don't understand how this hotel still survives these days. If you don't want to ruin your enjoyable memory in Orlando and save some money, just avoid this hotel...

Reviews.Title: “New years 2008/2009”
Reviews.Author: CynthiaOntariocanada
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort over new years. We loved the waterpark as it was smaller and easy to relax and keep an eye on the kids. The kids kept busy in the lazy river and going on the slides. My only complaint was the high noise level early in the morning!!! The wall are very thin and you can hear everything. We were woke up very early every morning by the staff pushing carts along the balconies...honestly it sounded like a freight train coming thru our room. Other than that , it was a nice place to stay with younger kids.

Reviews.Title: “It was OK”
Reviews.Author: ae1973
Reviews.Content: The pool and waterpark area is nice, but one of the 3 slides was not available at least one day. Also, the lazy river was closed for part of the trip. I think they needed more water flowing on the slides, came to a complete stop mid-slide several times. We had a King Suite with Jacuzzi. The door between the living area and bedroom was a regular hotel room connector with a door on each side. The bedroom had it's own entrance. At one point they were two seperate rooms. The room key didn't work on the entrance to the bedroom. This caused us to get locked out of each side a couple of times and had to get the front desk to come help us. Once the maid shut the connector door and locked us out dispite the fact that we had a Do Not Disturb sign in the main lock. There is a restaurant onsite, but it is limited in it's breakfast choices. One day we had such bad service, after we got up several times to get our own coffee, waited forever for the food, and sent the food back 2 times, we told them to forget it and we went to another restaurant. I believed it might have been the waitresses first day on the job, and in fact, it might have been her first time in a restaurant because she was clueless. Apparently whoever was in the kitchen didn't know how to make eggs over easy either. They screwed that up 2 times. We ended up paying $100 a night because they charge you some add-on fees. On the positive side, the pool was heated. The King bed was comfortable as was the bedding. It was clean. It had a microwave and a couple of fridges. Kitchen sink. Big TVs. Overall enjoyed stay except for those few problems.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: Steve J
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in the waterpark view double queen room, it was only $5 more than the cheapest room and it was very nice and clean. The only complaints we had were about the waterpark. Our 4 year old was too short to ride the big slides even though she is a great swimmer. So she had to play in the kiddie section. The kiddie section slides are small but fast and short you out onto the shallow concrete pool bottom. My daughter had red patches all over her but and thighs from sliding across the concrete. Didn't anyone test this out first? So she could only take it a few times and then she was done with the slides. There were also three big slides, but one did not work. That it. Otherwise not bad. I would stay at the Nick hotel over this one. It has a lot more going on, but it is a lot busier and more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised - Will Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: jobber72
Reviews.Content: We researched Disney hotels and various other hotels in the Orlando area months in advance. We chose the Clarion due to the mostly positive feedback coupled with the cost. We stayed four nights (Dec 9 - 12) in a Queen Suite on the top (3rd) floor. Driving in, I was a little leery because of the location to the highway and the somewhat under-construction-semi-rundown look of the property around the hotel. But once we entered our room, we were very encouraged by the look and layout of our room. It was very spacious in the living room area which had a huge (50 inch?) plasma and bunk bed for the kids. The furniture was clean and looked very new, along with new tile & cupboards in the kitchenette and hallway area. The carpet was nice and clean along with the bathroom. It was obvious the hotel was remodeled within the last few years - they did a great job in the rooms. The queen beds were comfortable. And there was another plasma in the bedroom. I think a 42 inch. The view was very nice - the suites include a private balcony which overlooks the waterpark. Now for the waterpark...I liked it a lot. We've got a 6 yr old, 4 yr old and 18 mo old. The slides were great because they ended in something like 6 inches of water so no fear of a younger kid having trouble by getting dumped into a huge pool or anything. My 6 year old loved the slides. My 4 year old was quite a bit too short so she hung out in the lazy river and with her 18 month old sibling in the kiddy waterpark area. Location...The hotel sits right on one of the main drags in Kissimmee/Orlando. Hwy 192 (3 lane divided road with moderate traffic) which is less a highway and more a county road type street. I think the speed limit is 45 or something. Anyway, you get on 192 right out of the parking lot and 30 minutes later you will be at the Magic Kingdom/Epcot/etc gate. It's a nice, easy drive that even I couldn't screw up. Food...Go left or right (east or west) on 192. Within 5 to 10 minutes in either direction you have every fast food restaurant known to man. Sonic, McDonalds, BK, DQ, KFC, Taco Bell, Pizza Hut, etc. You also have Target, Wal Mart, Sams Club, BJs, Winn Dixie, etc. Seriously...you'll find everything. All in all, I feel great that we saved probably $500 to $700 on our hotel stay versus a comparable Disney hotel room. And on top of that had a great time at the waterpark which was included with the room. We're already planning on returning for another vacation in October 2009.

Reviews.Title: “Great Waterpark”
Reviews.Author: familyguy1977
Reviews.Content: We booked through the hotels website www.clarionwaterpark.com and happy we did. We received emails prior to our stay providing us with information that was a great help, something that I am not used to when booking with other sites. Kids loved the lazy river! We choose the standard view room to save $10 per night, but our view was nice as we overlooked an open field where my daughter walked our dog. Hotel staff was very nice and accommodating to our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the family atmosphere!”
Reviews.Author: DancingDaytonFamily
Reviews.Content: My kids and I really enjoyed our stay there! Our room was on the second floor , quiet , and it was very clean and roomy. I would recommend not staying on the main floor as it can get noisey with the swimmers and the traffic around the rooms! Kids loved the slides but some of the seams were rough and kids had scratches on them especially from the little kids ones...but, over all one of our favourite hotels to relax and enjoy the heat and sun! I also loved the price, we booked the 25% discount saver so I think I paid around $59 per a night! Would go there again!

Reviews.Title: “Nasty”
Reviews.Author: jojo2Massachusetts
Reviews.Content: I would never stay here or any other hotels associated with this hotel again.The place was dirty.When we checked in there was food on the floor from the people before us.The rug turned our socks black.My son spilled milk on the sheets and they never changed them I had to go to the manager who assured me he would supervise them clean our room.It never happened.The bathroom was was down right disgusting.My sons asthma medicine was stolen out of the room along with 18 mini bags of potato chips.I spoke to the night manager who preceded to bacically tell me I was lying.My son could die why would I keep his medicine from him.My husband spoke to the general manager who was rude and had absolutely no idea on how to speak to people that and the fact that he lied .He told my husband that there were security camers all over our floor yeah there wasn't.We checked all around the hotel and the manager lied to us.Then we wanted to check out early and was told we could but would have to pay the remainder of the time which would have been about 250.00.The waterpark that they charge you for half the time we waited for the lifeguard to come back from break even though they had just opened.The slides you had to push yourself down.Do not waste your time or money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Bug02144
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Clarion waterpark resort 10/1-10/7 2008. I booked on Priceline using the negotiator and got a rate of $42 a night. I was a little worried but it was better than expected. Lobby was nice pool area too. We did not get a chance to use the waterpark as it is only open until 6pm and we were out at the parks but it looked nice. The room was very nice well decorated and included a little kitchenette which came in handy. We got a 2 bed queen suite since that is what priceline booked us. We did try to switch and pay the difference for a king room but they would not let us. Even though it was pretty clear they were well under booked. But, beds were comfy. Bathroom clean and well-appointed. We did not visit the cafe or anything but it looked nice. We were above the arcade and they leave it going all night (even though it closes early)so we did hear a little bit from that but otherwise it was pretty quiet. House keeping did a great job also. The only complaint I really have I noticed the morning we checked out otherwise it would have been gross-the inbetween down comforter thing that goes inbetween the top sheet and blanket had some icky brown spots on it and it sorta looked like baby poop or puke. Sooooooo we will stay here again for sure but I will make sure to check the bedding ;) Hotel is close to everything too. We rented a car and got everywhere within minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Clarion Waterpark”
Reviews.Author: horners4
Reviews.Content: Loved the waterpark. The rooms nice too. The kids had a blast! Absolutely no complaints!!!

Reviews.Title: “Clarion Resort”
Reviews.Author: kristy529
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because of the great price. We saw the waterpark and thought it would be a great place to stay. We arrived and I was completely shocked at how big the family suite was. The room was huge! We have 3 children from 4-15 and it was perfect. The room was super clean. The only bad thing was if you are not able to walk up two flights of stairs then don't book the family suite. The only elevator is in the hotel lobby, no where near your room. Another bad thing is that it took us 45 minutes to get to Disney World on a Saturday. It is to far away, probably be less traffic on a different day. The two younger kids enjoyed the water park but the 15 y.o. not interested at all. Would stay here again for the price if I was doing something in the area. The room itself was great!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it.”
Reviews.Author: Gang_of_Four
Reviews.Content: We went with 2 10 year old kids for 10 days & they loved it. On our 1st day we used the water park all afternoon & everyone had fun. Is the biggest & baddest water park? Certainly not but Disney charges over $50 per person per day, Clarion is $12 per room per day. We played in the pool, played outdoor chess, and then to the hot-tub & water park. They provide life-jackets to the wee-ones and have life guards on duty in the water park but not the pool itself. One day during Tropical storm fay the pool was closed, but the staff had all the board games out in the game room and had a staff member animating the group of kids. This is in addition to the arcade room. My wife is very nervous about letting the kids run, but she had no problem here telling the kids to go play with her being right behind them. We asked for an upgrade to a kids suite (same sized room just with a bunk bed bed & queen bed) & the staff was able to with no problems. The dryers in the laundry room were terrible it cost $10 trying to dry one load of laundry. They need to get better machines. Everything was fairly close (Disney 15-25 min away depending on which park you went to) but we made a mistake of not renting a car & thought the shuttle would have been enough to get around. There is very little within walking distance of the hotel, but lots of things within a 15 minute drive. We rented a car on the 2nd day! So for families with young kids: it was great: clean, bright, helpful staff, and reasonable prices. Each room was brightly decorated room and had a flat panel TV. We would go back again with no hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Room Nasty!!!”
Reviews.Author: katiebug0502
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night. We thought it was going to be a good experience from the pictures on the web site but we were completley wrong...When we arrived and walked into the room the floor really caught my attention. It was down right nasty!!! Then on to the bathroom---can we say gross!!! What really got me is later that night a roach crawled across the bathroom floor---I about panicked!!! The waterpark outside was nice but the rooms were just NASTY!!!

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: SharonRN
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean, the waterpark was awesome, the price was good (they were very upfront about the $12 resort fee, and we certainly got our money's worth out of it). The only problem I had was when I ordered $95 worth of pizza at the bar and the bartender added an 18% gratuity to the order; I asked him if they were going to deliver it to the room and he said, no, you come back in a few minutes and pick it up. Hmmmm.... so for a $17 gratuity you don't even deliver the pizza to the room? I cancelled the pizza order immediately and he couldn't understand why. All of the food and beverages have an added 18% gratuity, which is fine if you know about it and also if there is actually some service involved!! I called PaPa John's and got the same amount of pizza for $55. The bartender at the waterpark area bar was awesome and worth his tip. We will definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pass this over, go to Nick instead”
Reviews.Author: mwitman
Reviews.Content: This hotel bills itself as a resort. It is not. The waterpark is very disappointing. I went with family, 10 year old twins and spouse. They all disliked the water park. The kids complained the pool was too deep, no place for them to stand. The waterslides are poor. Both kids and myself, as well as many other guests, got stuck in the two circular slides. We hand to use our hands to push ourselves threw the slide. Not fun at all. My kids refused to go down the slides again. And the waterpark was the main reason we went to this hotel. The room is so-so. We had the queen with bunk beds. The bunks are set so that someone in the lowe bunk can't watch the tv. So the kids were both in the top bunk most of the time. The bunks are also right next to the queen bed, not in a separte nook. We had some maintenance problems with the room which were never fixed, such as no telephone service. They ran out of facial tissues at the hotel and were not expecting any in for two day, no ice in the ice maker. Over all, a fair place to sleep. But for a really good experience, spend a little more and go to the Nick Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find in Orlando Area”
Reviews.Author: aperetz
Reviews.Content: I have been travelling to the Disney area resorts during my entire life: I am a native, so I have a great knowledge base to make comparisons. I now have two kids and my trips have gone from travelling with friends to travelling with my two kids (age 12 and 9). This hotel packs alot of punch! If you are looking for an affordable hotel, with great services, with such easy access off the highways that render all of the attractions (disney, universal, sea world etc) a quick drive,then this is the place for you. The room we stayed in was a so-called kids suite: it was huge and clean and very comfortable. The front room had bunks for the kids and the back room had two queens that opened up to a balcony that overlookked the waterpark. Dont be misled, the rooms are nice, and have been refurbished lately, so while not the ritz, it's perfect for our needs. (I liked the cleanliness and double sheeted beds. And each room had a flat screen cable tv.) And the room had a great area if one desired to eat meals in, as it had a large refrigerator, sink and microwave. The hotel has all the amenities, snack bar, business center, anbd a great game room for the kids. The staff was very nice and made the extra effort to give me directions to a number of restuarants we desired to reach after our day at the parks. The hotel is NOT located right necxt to any aresa resorts. I thoughtt this would be an issue at first, as it is located right off Florida's Turnpike and 192, However, it's lcoation turned out to be a positive. It took us 20 minutes to Dinsey via Oceola Parkway, 20 minutes door to door to Universay/Blue Man group via Turnpike and I-4. That is, the Hotel actually alllowed us to avoid all of the traffic/congestion had we been staying closer to Disney or any of the International Drive hotels. And at the end of the trip we were 30 seconds to the Turnpike anbd back home! ( Finally, the Waterpark didnt disspapoint. I spent the middle part of one day with my 9 year old daughter at the waterpark. THe hotel actually frames the entire waterpark,, which is comprised of three great slides (one completely tunneled and dark), a fun and delightful "lazy river" with good speed so you can literally do nothing but relex with intermitten waterfalls over head to cool you down further. Also, the hotel provides an entire staff which presents great water games, and challenges etc for the kids and adults alike and a hair braiding station. The hotel should not be compared to nor does it try to compete with the higher end (read: expensive) resorts in the disney area. But if you are looking for a great alternative that allows you put your money into al of the attractions and entertainemnt the area has to offer, then i would not hesitate to book this hotel for your family: Overall it was a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and waterpark”
Reviews.Author: mmme
Reviews.Content: This hotel is sparkling clean from the moment you walk into the lobby to check in, throughout the corridors and into the room. The staff are very friendly, even passing in the corridors everyone says hello with a smile. The waterpark was outstanding, my kids could have stayed all day in there. There's a game room on site for when the thunderstorms came and the waterpark temporarily shut down. There's also a regular pool but we never used it. There's even a bar near the waterpark which had drinks and snaks/light meals. We ate at the restaurant one night, the waiter was very friendly and the food was great. There's a nice little coffee place in the lobby (I do wish that stayed open all day, just seemed to be open in the morning). The room was very well appointed with everything we needed, lots of towels, a bunch of pillows, microwave, refrigerator and all the shower necessities. The room was decorated in bright, tropical colors. . It's about 1/2 hour drive to Disney and Universal - it's at the far end of Kissimee. I didn't venture out too much in the surrounding area, the hotel is right off the Florida Turnpike which is very convenient when going to the theme park. Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel to all families

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to relax and enjoy life”
Reviews.Author: 1BobbyJoe
Reviews.Content: It was my birthday and the manager with out me asking for, he upgrated our room to the ones with a jacuzzi in it, great room, also was so kind to offer us a complementary breakfast the next morning that was plentifull and delicious, at the front office they were extra heplfull in giving us the short and fast way to get to Disney World, it was a great way to start celebrating my birthday. I will certainly be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Up and Coming”
Reviews.Author: sogoodwin
Reviews.Content: The stay was good with the exception that you seem to have a problem with providing towels and wash cloths. My room had a faulty toilet that backed up immediately. There was a leak in the bathroom. The phone did not work and 3 of the 4 bulbs in the bathroom were blown. My room was 1252. When I went to the office to let the front desk know I was having issues the response was not one of urgency but we will get to it as soon as we can.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: croppinbren
Reviews.Content: This is an awesome family resort. The prices are affordable and once we were there we had no desire to be in any other park. The lazy river sitting on a tube floating away, is a great way to destress and have fun. "I'm being a kid again", is one of the statements I heard over and over amongst the adults. Imagine being able to be in one place where you're floating on the tube and your kids are above you coming down the slides. All having fun at the same time and doing what you want to do. We are very family oriented and do lots of stuff together. This resort gave the opportunity to be together and be individuals. A place for all ages. There was an abundance of other activities organized by the water staff. An arts & craft room, arcade, fitness room, restaurant with a very good buffet selection at all meals. Breakfast was $7.95/adult and $5/12 and under. Cabanas with fans and tables/chairs for rent so you don't have to be in the hot sun all the time. Tiki bar with a large variety of drinks for all ages and pizza. The staff was very friendly and caring, the rooms very clean and updated. The whole place set a tropical atmosphere and if we could we'd go up there every month. Every family needs to check this place out!! KBK in Fla.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: knw4ever
Reviews.Content: Our hotel stay waswonderful. I was a bit worried when I read the reviews, but all of them were unfounded. We originally booked a room with two double beds, when my husband decided not to come I called at the last minute and chaged it to a king bed, though the hotel was booked, they upgraded me to a king suite at no charge. Check in was a breeze, no problems, very nice staff. The room was spacious and clean. Very nice, better than other average strip hotels in the area. Pool area was great. I recommend getting a cabana for the day if you will be in the pool area the whole day (we were and the kids loved it). Staff even told me about a coupon at the front desk which saved us some money on the cabana ($40 for the day). Restaurant was ok, typical strip hotel fare, same as the food by the pool. I had a small problem at check out where the rate for the second night was not what was quoted on my reservation. I went to get the reservation from my purse and the gentlemen said it was not necessary and imediately he had a manager over to correct the rate. I will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “family fun weekend”
Reviews.Author: duffer1940
Reviews.Content: my wife,daughter,son & grandson had a wonderful time.i pulled my back out onfriday after a full day at universal. i was so bad we decided not to go back on sat. & it looked like i would stay in the room all day in pain.my family went to the pool & i stayed in the room.a little whild later my wife calls me and says"come on down to our tent & hot tub" not knowing what to expect i go down & right at the pool my family has a beaytiful tent and then i go into the hot tub & let the jets do a heat warming move on my. back.wow i was so much better we went back to universal on sunday.another special report. we had the best pizza in florida for dinner.never had to leave the motel the entire day.i meet a lady friday who told me she had 5 chielden and they had a suite and it was plenty of room for their family and they allways have a great time. more good news 18min.from mickey & all of disney thanks for great family memories sincerly fred ford

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: tampamom61
Reviews.Content: What a disappointing trip to the Clarion Waterpark! First of all, their height restriction for the slide is not clearly posted on their website, and is higher than all the real water parks in the area. We made a trip specifically for this reason, and my 7 year old was heartbroken that she couldn't use the slide. The baby part of the park was also closed for cleaning, so her only option was the pool. We ordered pizza, which was uncooked, greasy and wet. We tried the lounge for dinner, and the food was inedible. They gave us a room facing the "water park", and we were kept awake until after 2am with laughs and screams from a group that had assembled in the park area to party. The beds were uncomfortable and small. The room was clean. I would sleep in my car before I stayed at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: FloridaJoey
Reviews.Content: All I have to say is you get what you pay for........Water park and lazy river very small. Looks like this was a closed hotel and they came in and tried to fix it up, Our room wasn;t bad. I'm glad we only stayed here one night though.

Reviews.Title: “Photos make it look nicer than it is.”
Reviews.Author: Fla_Traveler9
Reviews.Content: This motel would have been nicer if it wasn't for the unexepected resort fee of $13.56/day, of which I'm certain I got charged for twice, once by Expedia and then again by the Clarion. Even when I showed the Clarion manager my Expedia receipt that showed an extra $23/day fee ($10 taxes, $13 other), they still argued with me for a long time. Then they finally agreed with my receipt, said they would't charge us, and then charged my credit card anyway after we went home! I left 2 messages for them to call me back on this matter, which of course they just ignored. Learn from my lesson and don't trust what they tell you. Not to dwell on this topic, but if there is a Clarion CEO out there somewhere, you need to pay attention to this. In the several times I was at the front desk arguing my case, I watched many guests check-in and check-out and be told of this extra 'manditory' $13.56/day 'Resort Fee'. I saw the shocked look on their faces and how mad they were when they left. Is that any way to run a motel? Make all your guests mad? Do you think they're going to come back? If this fee is maniditory, it should be in the price of the motel. This is deceptive advertising. As for what the other guests commented about, I can verify most. This motel is a lot farther from the theme parks than most others. The waterpark hours aren't that long - if you go to a theme park, then forget it. Their shuttle only goes once a day and it's not free to SeaWorld or Universal. There were indeed bus loads of local kids coming to the waterpark causing long lines at the slides, using up all the inner tubes for the lazy river and basically being unruly with little adult supervision. This place also has no right to call itself a 'Resort'. It is a remodeled motel of the kind where you park in front of your room. The rooms are your basic 2-3 star quality where the furniture takes up about 80% of the room. The bathroom is tiny and the water pressure in the shower is very low. The walls are paper thin and you can hear every word from the rooms around you. There was no information guide in the room and the rooms were cleaned late in the day. Another weird thing is they make you sign an agreement that you'll pay them $300 if you smoke in their room. What Clarion manager came up with that gem? I can't imagine how they'd enforce it. But I guess they are going for the scare factor (another great way to treat your guests!). This of course, led to all the smokers smoking in the corridors which cheapened the place in a different way! There were a few good things. The place is kid-friendly but mostly for the smaller kids. The rooms were clean and they had frigs and microwaves. They have another pool for after the waterpark closes. They have lots of different amenities like a gift shop, game room, computer room, kid activities, coffee in the lobby and breakfast - but be warned, they charge for all of them!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay .......”
Reviews.Author: Garcia745
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from July 27 to August 3, 2008. We had a great time. However, small things would have made our stay more pleasant. I would have liked some kind of information sheet left in the room detailing the daily activities for guests, how much their "famous" Mindy O's pizza is, etc. We were also assured that my hubby could wear his prescription sunglasses on the water slides (he can't see without them) as long as he had a strap on them so they wouldn't fall off. We went out before our trip began and purchased a strap specifically for this purpose. He went down the slides the first day, but the second day he was told he couldn't wear them (even with the strap on) because someone had hurt themselves earlier in the day.....hubby was prepared to accept the risks...but they insisted he remove them. Because of this he never went back to the waterpark....also, my son wasn't able to wear his swim goggles down the slides at all....doesn't seem right - especially after being told there would be no problem. The walls are paper thin - you can hear conversations, etc that your neighbours are having. So, be aware - if you can hear them, they can hear you !! Overall, I do recommend the hotel. It was a good place to stay....

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here if you have allergies to dust mites”
Reviews.Author: DaliMama
Reviews.Content: This Inn is okay, a pretty good deal for the price (we paid $69/night)and the water slides & pools are nice for the kids. The place could use some attention to detail though - I have an allergy to dust mites and I can tell you from experience that this place needs to use allergy covers on the beds or use a hepa filter throughout the rooms. Long story, short.. if you or your kids have this allergy, don't stay here. The front desk folks could be nicer too. I received rude, short denies for quarters - literally no one at the restaurant, front desk, pool bar or gift shop could give me change which I found sort of strange.

Reviews.Title: “Hated it”
Reviews.Author: arrest2
Reviews.Content: I booked this vacation after seeing the website. It was a horrible experience. When I arrived I had to wait over 15 minutes to begin checking in and there was only 1 person in front of me. I saw other front desk personnel walk to the front desk, look at me and walk away or simply begin talking with another employee. The poor guy doing the check in was new and trying the best he could. Once I got to my room, it was newly decorated, but the shower was horrible. I would not even want to think of taking a shower in it. It looked dirty and unsanitary. The kitchenette they discribed, well, its a counter with a microwave that doubles as a vanity counter. Needless to say my 4 year was excited to be there so I decided to give it a chance. As we sat in the room, my husband had bugs crawling on him. We tried to go to the "waterpark", which was the reason we stayed at this hotel. The person passing out the arm bands...rude. She yelled at my son not to stand on his tippy toes while she measured him and then said he was just shy of being able to go on the slides. I asked to speak to someone else, They took him to be measured by the "accurate" measuring device. He just went to the doctor and measured 46", they said he was 43 1/2" and needed to be 44" to ride the slide. Since this was the reason we came to this "resort" we decided to check out. I asked to speak to a manager after advising we were checking out after only being there an hour. I was told they were in a metting. I said I didn't care. I finally got to speak to the waterpark manager. I completely understand child safety, I deal with it as a career. He said he got the "measuring" device from a national home improvement store. He said he would give my son an armband that may work and let him on the slide. We did not want to base our vacation on may could possibly work. The manager stated it was listed on the website, you must be 44" to ride the slides. Well after searching for this when I returned home, because it is hidden in the description, I missed it. Even if I had seen it, since he measured taller than that at his pediatrician, wouldn't think I have to worry. Not to mention we didn't feel safe at the hotel. It is in the middle of no where and nothing close by to eat or do anything else. I was able to finally check out. We went to the other water park hotel in Orlando and the water park was larger and much better. The rooms were much cleaner and the staff much more attentive. The slides were larger and actually had more of them. My son was able to ride each and everyone of them. We all had a blast at this location. I would NOT recommend this hotel. It may call itself a resort or water park, but it was far from that.

Reviews.Title: “think you are getting a good deal?”
Reviews.Author: lanas4crazies
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the Clarion resort and waterpark the end of July. The hotel was very clean and most of the staff was friendly and somewhat helpful. But if you book at this hotel Please make sure you pay attention to ALL the fees which really are not worth the stay. The water park area was better than what I expected but if you are in Orlando to go to amusement parks we found it difficult to use the waterpark due to the hours open they open at nine and close at seven so this really gives you no time to enjoy it. They have a breakfast buffet but charge $8 for it which is not worth it so we went to store and bought things since there is refrig. and microwave in the room and we ate at a resteraunte which was cheaper and tasted better. They offer complimentary coffee in lobby but they don't mention this till you complain that the coffee shop in lobby is not open till 8 The rooms are small but is ok if you are there basically just to sleep was ok for us since was just husband, son and myself. I do not recmmend more than 2 adults in a rm. though But the beds are very comfortable and rms. very clean. They do have a fittness rm. w/ updated equipment. There is an arcade rm. and a bussiness center but they charge for computer use 20 cents a min. They offer activities for the kids but they charge for most of those as well but again we didn't even have the time to do the activities.It is a nice hotel but to me was just not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay.....absolutely recommend it”
Reviews.Author: kcmmom99
Reviews.Content: The staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful with any situtation we had. The rooms were clean and did not smell mildewed as some hotels I have stayed in that have pools due to wet carpets. The lifeguards are always very attentative when the waterpark is open. This was my 2nd stay here and have already reserved to go back again in March 2009. I would highly recommend this hotel to parents of kids, there is alot of activities to do.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Pool”
Reviews.Author: jhd28
Reviews.Content: Rooms are very nice, pool and waterpark area are great, computer use for internet is wonderful, restaurant good, inside gift shop is expensive, finding entrance to hotel was not easy, and location is far out. Didn't have a folder telling you about the hotel, services, or times for various things. Only hotel I've been in that didn't have one and it really needed one. Kept having to call or go ask the front desk. The people were really nice there.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Clarion”
Reviews.Author: CowgirlOKC
Reviews.Content: Excellent property---water park is such fun! Three nice waterslides and very large clean pool. The rooms are nicely appointed with VERY comfortable beds and plush pillows. We will stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel if possible!”
Reviews.Author: destinationthere
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family as we were visiting the area to take in the theme park attractions. We were looking for an average hotel (based on price, distance to attractions, and services offerred) and use Trip Advisor extensively when planning any vacations. We also took into consideration that the hotel carried the Clarion name and we have stayed at many of the Clarion family of hoteles (Clarion, Cambria). That's the background- now here is my review....... We were disappointed overall by the distance from almost anything we tried to find (restaurants, shopping, theme parks). Despite this hotel indicating that there is a complimentary shuttle to Disney, we discovered that the shuttle to Magic Kingdom leaves at 10:30 (told to be prepared for delays due to weather) and when you add the at least 40 minute drive to that, you can bet on at least 11:20 before you hit the entrance to Magic Kingdom. That is absolutley silly because you may as well not even bother going as that is peak times and you won't get anywhere at Disney by then! We opted to use our rental car instead, which added gasoline and parking to our expenses. We were disappointed by the poor communication of most staff (I am speaking not of accent or language, but of their overall interaction with customers.) We confirmed prior to booking the hotel that a continental breakfast was included but this was not to be found when we looked each morning. Finally, near the end of our stay, when I was becoming upset about our general experience, I asked another staff, who told me that I must provide documentation to prove that it was part of our booking, and only then would she be prepared to give me the necessary voucher to have breakfast at the restaurant. Once I dug out the required documents she presented me with a coupon, which we used on our last few days there. I felt like we had to beg for virtually everything that should have just come naturally. My husband even had to go to the front dest to get a listing of TV channels, map of the hotel, and schedule of shuttles, as no general orientation manual (as is found in every other hotel room I've stayed in, even in other countries) is available. The restaurant staff were friendly and helpful. The cleanliness of our room was questionable. We noted many marks on the walls from dead insects or handprints left my other guests. Our room didn't appear to be getting any cleaning so my husband requested that it be vacuumed. It was done on the day he asked but nothing else was (ie. no towels, no cleaning in the bathroom). One day I left a few things in certain spots to see if they would be moved (eg. toilet paper roll near the toilet, loose thread on the floor near the fridge) to indicate if things were being swept, and we discovered they were still there, untouched that evening. When we asked for something we got it, but otherwise it didn't happen. We had to go to the front desk for shampoo (which we then received, but not after) and clothes (received two on our last day, the only time!), and eventually just bought our own at Target so that it was there when we needed it. We discovered tags and crumbs from previous guests purchases and food under our beds. We did not find any roaches as was noted on another review, but I can say that I kept a look out for the possibility because we found small bugs in any food that was on the counter (cookie bags, chips). If we opened anything, we either ate it all or threw it out! The hallways were dirty and sometimes covered in water (inside stairs, not from rain) which my son slipped on several times. The washer and dryer (out in the open, basically anyone could access it and take your things) were not working. The walls are paper thin and we heard every sound that came from the room next to us, (talking, television). Likewise, our neighbors heard every sound from our room as when our daughter had a nightmare one night and was crying out loudly, the neighbouring room let us know about it the next morning. I had a problem with the "resort fee" as we emailed ahead to ask if the use of the pool was included in our hotel charge, which we had paid already. We were informed that it was so the $12.00 a day that we had to pay once we got there was unexpected. When asked for further clarification about the fee I was told that it also covered the use of the in-room safe, the fridge, the microwave, shuttles to Disney, and a coupon for a discount on a cabana at the waterpark. This seems a little silly to me because when informed that I was not using the shuttles (because of the aformentioned inconvenient schedule), did not intend to use the waterpark because our days were planned for the theme parks (of which we had passes to Disney's waterparks) and therefore would also not require a cabana, and asked what they intended to do if I chose not to pay the fee, they told me it was not optional, that I had to pay it! I must mention that I did not cause any fuss but inquired quietly, what I feel is respectfully and usually not in front of a group of people. I did observe other guests in quite heated disputes with reception staff and I must say that in most cases it would appear as though guests opinions and feelings were not respected. On the morning of my check out I saw one gentleman disputing the "resort fee" charges and he was basically told to go away and shut up. He demanded to speak with a manager and was told, by another staff than the one standing there when I came upon the scene, that he could not. He told them he was prepared to wait and was once again told to go away as it would be of no benefit to speak with the manager, that the fee would be charged either way. I should mention that was the worst example I saw, but there were several other examples of staff being quite disrespectful to guests. I would never stay here again, even if it were free. There's a lot to be said for a good night's sleep in a safe and clean hotel, and you won't get that at the Clarion Hotel and Waterpark!

Reviews.Title: “What a great little resort”
Reviews.Author: dawegriffiths
Reviews.Content: This was a great resort. The rooms were clean, and everything was provided, microwave, fridge, and safe. The waterpark was great , they provided towels and everything was clean and well taken care of. We arrived early and although they didn't have a room ready for us, we were welcome to use the facilities. That was great, we spent day at the waterpark then checked in when our room was ready. Our only complaint would be the bar/restaurant area outside. We waited nearly 20 minutes for someone to show-up at the bar, we ordered drinks and pizza and we're charged a manatory 18% tip on the bill. Then when our pizza was ready he didn't even bring it to us. He shouted to us across the deck that our pizza was ready. He certainly didn't deserve that tip!

Reviews.Title: “Great for Florida residents”
Reviews.Author: FloridaMandmmom
Reviews.Content: We only live about 45 minutes from this hotel so we thought we'd try it out for a mini vacation! We had a great stay. As others have said it is not in the best location but well worth the stay. The hotel itself feels very safe and is very pretty and clean. The waterpark is terrific and the kids loved it! We went on a Tuesday and Wednesday and it was never crowded. The front desk was always helpful. We did venture out for dinner and were pleased with the selection you just neeed to drive around a bit to find something. This hotel is perfect if you live in Florida and want a mini vacation away from all the Disney crowds! We will definitely stay again. I only gave it four stars because of the location.

Reviews.Title: “Pictures Are Decieving”
Reviews.Author: YravelReviews4U
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel because I thought that the Water Park would be good for the kids after a long day of travel. Unfortuantely, we were terribly disappointed. The Waterpark was closed by the time we arrived (~ 7 o'clock) and is extremely small. It looks more like a mini playground for preschool age children. When we arrived on Sunday, the place was packed with local people and we had to park a long way from our room. There was a large group of locals who were quite rowdy. Because of this, my kids were afraid to leave the room. The hotel is styled really just an older Motel, but the rooms were clean (tile floors). Since we didn't feel comfortable driving around the area, we ate at the hotel. The food was very good, but service was very slow (1.5 hours before food arrived at table). I was very surprised with the reality of the hotel based on the reviews and photos that I had seen. The only people that would enjoy the WaterPark are families with very small children. There are worst hotels than this one, but my advise would be to pay a little more and stay somehere nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worthy of the Clarion Name”
Reviews.Author: derloc12
Reviews.Content: My Family of 4 stayed her for 11 nights in july 2008, our Kids are aged 7 and 4. We were in the area to visit disney world. I am a regular Tripadvisor reviewer and customer and I always use trip advisor to help me in selecting my hotels. We booked this trip through expedia and we paid appox $65 per night (an estimate, as it was a packaged deal.) this was one of the few times that I somewhat ignored some of the reviews given by fellow trip advisors, part of the reson for this is that I was impressed that the hotel management had responded to most of the negative reviews on this website. I realize now that this seems to be the speciality of the hotel management team, as I seen it performed live with multiple hotel guests and again with my family. one of the concerns that I had before checking into the resort was that several trip advisor members stated that they were charged additional "resort fees" once they arrived at the hotel. so I emailed the hotel before my arrival to check it out. the reply I got from izzy fintz the hotels vp of hospitality was: "The price of all our amenities is included with your stay for the price for the room plus resort fee plus tax.We look forward to your stay you will have a great time."(cut and pasted from the email) I thougt this was a little vauge but I assumed that the fees I had already paid to expedia would have covered this just like all the other items I booked (airline tickets, car) however when I arrived at the hotel, I was told no, that this was an additional charge that I would have to pay ($12 per night plus taxes) this cost would cover our use of the waterpark, plus kids craft area, entertainment and in room amenities such as a small refrigirator and microwave. In the end i had to pay this, as I had already paid for my room via expedia and if I went to another hotel I would have lost the money already paid. to me this is like paying for a airline flight in full and then showing up ready to board and having to pay a airport tax or something, on both check in and check out I witnessed several people arguing this with hotel staff and management, which is a good indication that something is un-just here. Moving on here's the rest of my review: Location : the resort is not in a great area I am a runner and I prefer to run outdoors but I was limited as I would not run in this area in anything less than full daylight. ( and I'm a 6'4" fairly large man),also it is a minumum 30 minute (on average more like 45 min) drive to any part of disney world. my gps system shows the distance being 16 miles but it is through allot of traffic to get to disney, this just seemed to add fustration to the beginning and end of our days. The hotel appearance: it is motel style with exterior hallways, which raises concerns of safety, security, and also easy access for bugs ect... it is obviously a older hotel with a fresh coat of paint, I found the exterior hallways very dirty, with debris from wind and rain, but also some cigarrete butts (not the hotels fault as there is alot of well placed recepticles for the butts, just people don't seem to use them. The Room was well furnished and the furniture was in good shape. The carpet in our room was completely gross, very dirty with lots of stains. the sink area and bathroom tiles were nice, and modern. a huge problem with this room was that the walls are very "thin" you can here every thing (including people snoring in adjecent rooms) I had to have the bathroom fan on and the air conditioner fan on high to drown out the noise so I could get the kids to sleep. also, the bathroom always smelled like smoke, no matter what, and neither me nor my wife smoke so it was hard to shower as the smell was very strong. also the television signal was very por and often blurry. However the wi-Fi internet worked really well. The water park: Very nice, although we only used it once for about an hour (we had passes for disneys waterparks) the water park was well staffed and seemed to be a big hit with many other guests. Housekeeping: terrible, Our room was vacuumed once in 11 days and that was only after I asked Nina at the front desk to have the room fully serviced. the only time the tiled area around the bathroom and sink area was cleaned was by myself or my wife, as the maid never did it. whenever we ran out of shampoo I had to go to the front desk or find housekeeping staff in the hallway to get some as the maid never left any. when I was doing my final check of the room when we were getting ready to leave, I found lots of garbage behind the beds and under furniture that was not from us. during our stay we also spent time cleaning the walls in our room where previous guests had killed bugs against the wall and neither they nor the housekeepers had cleaned the wall after.Also we never got face cloths, ever, which we ended up just going to target and buying some. Hotel Management: When talking to the the front desk staff, I found them to be for the most part very nice. However thay have obviously had alot of experience at taking complaints as they were very well rehearsed in their reponses to my or my wifes complaints. However we are not very aggressive people by nature so we were not as adamant as some guests as to getting resolve to our complaints, I witnessed some of the front desk staff/ management be very rude and extermly un-professional towards at least 2 diffrent customers who were asking to speak to upper management to get there problems resolved. When I made complaint about our room not being properly cleaned the lady at the front desk (Nina) called housekeeping right away to have it done (however they still did a very poor job). When my wife asked about the "continental breakfast" the front desk staff demanded we produce our booking info that stated it was included in our package. (we found it, and we ate the continental buffet for the last 4 days, only after paying for our first 7 days not realizing that it was included) The Resturant staff indicated to us that this is common and that it is something that the front desk often does. The Resturant: Was good, the staff very nice and the food was average for a hotel resturant. the hotel advertises a seattle's best coffee service, but don't get your hopes up for a great latte, most of the items were "unavailable" during our entire stay. In conclusion, I would not stay here again for several reasons including: the attitude of the management ,the distance from the theme parks, the overall condition of the hotel, and the house keeping. The "resort fee" is an issue I intend to bring up with the clarion group and also expedia, as I feel it is very mis-leading and fraudulant. it's tough when you spend a large amont of money to take your kids to "the happiest place on earth" and you find yourself driving by other hotels that are closer to disney and much nicer in apperance and in much nicer areas and wishing you were staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Fun,Relaxing & Enjoyable!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Caregivers
Reviews.Content: We visited for just one night to be closer to the airport, thought they had free transportation to airport but did not. We enjoyed the waterpark area, very clean & lots of staff to help. Organized activites for children everyday. The room was standard but clean. Liked the fact you can swim prior to getting into your room if not available before check in time however we arrived at 11:00 AM & THEY HAD A ROOM READY. Would STAY again!!

Reviews.Title: “amazing time”
Reviews.Author: shanle5
Reviews.Content: The clarion water park and resort is a great hotel. the service there is outstanding, the employees are very nice. i was amazed on how nice the room was and how clean it was. The hotel has a water park and a game room right inside it. They also have a all you can eat breakfast that is fantastic. All attractions are only 10-15 mins away i had a great time at this hotel i deffenitly recommed to stay here, and will stay there agian

Reviews.Title: “loved the Clarion resort”
Reviews.Author: sweetpea15
Reviews.Content: It was an awesome stay here, the water and pool surroundings was always clean. You dont expect it when you first drive by it since its right off the turnpike and on a street not that easy too spot from but overall ok. The rooms were clean and the beds wow very comfortable, would definitely come back again and again you dont have to go to any other park, it was awesome my son loved it so much he cried when we had to leave!. The only thing is that they should offer continental breakfast to complete the total package stay here, besides that like said its really worth it. We had a blast !! The Campillo Family Miami Florida B)

Reviews.Title: “great little getaway”
Reviews.Author: bigbucsfan
Reviews.Content: We went to the Clarion Water Park hotel this past week and had a wonderful time. We had only planned on staying 2 nights but our kids were having so much fun we added a 3rd night. The rooms were very nice and the Serta beds were very comfortable. Everything was brand new and very clean. Our room had a kitchenette with a small fridge, microwave and sink. This came in very handy for drinks and food for the kids. They totally loved the waterpark and played in it from open to close everyday. They also loved the arcade. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. They even had games and activities all day long for both kids and family in the pool area and the activities room such as big splash contests, t-shirt relays, family bingo and art projects for the kids to make. My kids made sun visors and loved it. The breakfast buffett was very good and was only $10 for adults and $5 for kids. I would recommend this hotel to all my friends. We did not do any of the theme parks this trip and my kids did not even care, they would rather have been at the Waterpark.........

Reviews.Title: “Has it's Pros and Cons”
Reviews.Author: BLD2
Reviews.Content: We were looking for something in the Orlando area without doing the whole "park" hopping thing because of the intense heat in July. I came acrossed Clarion Resort and Waterpark by doing a search for "Orlando family friendly weekend trips". The pictures were great, our 8 year old son was excited, we could have a nice relaxing 4 day weekend and not even have to leave the hotel (unless we wanted). I read all of the reviews and did my research. We were prepared for all of the pitfalls other guests had encountered (poor customer service, drive was far, hotel room not ready at check-in). Right off the bat, the 1st person I talked to at the hotel was an unfriendly girl with an extremely thick English accent. I opted to make my reservation online when I just couldn't understand her. Check-in time STARTS at 4pm - seriously, the housekeeping staff was cleaning rooms at ALL hours of the day and night. I think they are highly understaffed in this department. Although our room was fairly clean, it could have been cleaner. We paid for a waterpark view and the only view we had was the back of a blue tent structure. No other rooms (with a jacuzzi) were available when I attempted to change to a true waterpark view. The beds was very comfortable. The ceiling fan was nice. Although the hotel was recently "completely" renovated, it still screams 1970's. Now, the waterpark - the only reason we chose this hotel - we did have a good time. It wasn't the BLAST that I expected. We actually enjoyed the lazy river the most. But, all of the pictures were rather deceiving. This waterpark appeared much bigger online. It's pretty much 2 twisting slides, 1 normal slide and a lazy river (plus the normal pool and the toddler section). Our son didn't care for the slides because he said they hurt his back and they wouldn't let you keep a shirt on. The slides didn't open until 10am or later and closed at 7pm. We forgot to factor in the weather for this trip. They had to close down the waterpark at least 10 times while we were there because of lightning and thunder or "bad weather". It would be closed until the weather got better and then they'd announce it was re-opened. Most of the time we'd order a pizza (which was very good, sort of expensive and they add on 18% gratuity automatically) and go to the room, shower and go check out places we wanted to go. Probably our biggest issue was that the hotel was very far away from the major stuff. I believe they claim the hotel is 15 minutes from Disney (maybe at 3am in a race car going 100mph with no traffic or stoplights). We use to live in Orlando so we were familiar with the area and traffic problems, but this hotel is on the Kissimmee/St Cloud line, so it's a good drive to anything. Overall, for the price, I'd say it was a successful trip. Although the $12 per day resort fee is a laugh if you ask me. I want to know the criteria for being classified a "resort". We probably won't stay there again because we could have accomplished the same idea in a normal swimming pool. So overall, Pros: nice bed, good pizza, relax by the waterpark. Cons: very busy, too far out. Two things before I leave - we got a HUGE kick out of the fact that the washers and dryers are in a breezeway - open to the world and there are signs posted - "Wash at your own risk". Comic relief. Basically, if you walked away, say goodbye to your clothes. This isn't an upscale place folks. And lastly, if you get anywhere near this hotel or in the area, you MUST eat at Garibaldi's Mexican Restaurant. We had eaten at the "sister" restaurant in Orlando, but the one in Kissimmee is UNBELIEVABLY GREAT! The food was fantastic and the mariachi band was out of this world. We ate there Friday and Saturday night, yep, it was THAT good! Garibaldi's was without a doubt a major highlight of our trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay resort and waterpark”
Reviews.Author: slowpokeFlorida
Reviews.Content: I took my wife and 2 grandsons to the Clarion resort and waterpark. I upgraded to the waterpark side which I found to be a excellent choice. I got to watch my 2 grandsons in the waterpark for the two days that I stayed. I even got to slide on the rides that they have. I also like the lazy river ride and the waterfalls.
